items.q: Which incredibly influential 1993 game popularized the first-person shooter genre on PC?
items.explanation: Developed by id Software, it fundamentally set the standard for 3D action games.

items.q: The objective in 'Checkers' is to capture all of your opponent's pieces.
items.explanation: Pieces are captured by jumping over them diagonally.

items.q: In the game 'Cards Against Humanity', the player acting as the 'Card Czar' plays a white card.
items.explanation: The Card Czar reads the black prompt card and judges the white cards played by others.

items.q: What wildly popular racing game spin-off franchise fiercely tasks Nintendo characters with throwing colored turtle shells?
items.explanation: The chaotic multiplayer franchise is famous for ruining friendships via the blue shell.

items.q: Which highly strategic, beautiful board game features players attempting to establish a dominant medieval European empire?
items.explanation: It is a heavy, celebrated 'eurogame' known for deep strategy.

items.q: What critically acclaimed 2007 game tasks the player with exploring the ruined underwater city of Rapture?
items.explanation: The player uses weapons and genetically modified powers called Plasmids.

items.q: What specific board game genre involves players adding new cards to their personal play area throughout the game?
items.explanation: Games like Dominion pioneered this highly popular mechanic.

items.q: In the classic arcade game 'Asteroids', what abstract shape represents the player's ship?
items.explanation: The simple vector graphics were heavily iconic for the era.

items.q: What popular 1980 arcade game tasks the player with defending multiple cities from falling ballistic weapons?
items.explanation: It was inspired by the Cold War paranoia of the time.

items.q: What massively successful 2009 sandbox game allows players to build structures out of textured cubes in a 3D world?
items.explanation: Created by Markus 'Notch' Persson, it is the best-selling game of all time.
